Metadata: A new genus and species of caridean shrimp (Crustacea: Decapoda: Bresiliidae) from hydrothermal vents on Loihi Seamount, Hawaii
"Proceedings of the Biological Society of Washington," 108(2):228-237, June 22, 1995.

"Opaepele loihi", new genus and species, is described from hydro- thermal vents on Loihi Seamount, Hawaii, a mid-late, hot-spot volcano at 18 deg. 55'N, 155 deg. 16'W, 980 m depth. This new form is related to several other bresiliid shrimps associated with hydrothermal vents, brine and hydrocarbon seeps. Only two of the vent/seep bresiliid species are now known from depths less than 1000 m, "A. stactophila," from hydrocarbon seeps at 534 m in the Gulf of Mexico, and the present new species at 980 m.
